articles.title: Stocks Fall, Oil Climbs with Geopolitics in Focus: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg
articles.description: Asian equities fell and oil rose to its highest level since August as escalating tensions in Iran weighed on sentiment.

articles.description: New research shows midsize U.S. companies pay far more in Trump-era tariffs, and the costs land at home. The JPMorganChase Institute study says tariff payments for these companies tripled over the past year. The report says these businesses may have to raise …

articles.title: Japan inflation falls below BOJ's 2% target for first time since March 2022 - CNBC
articles.description: The 1.5% figure ended a run of 45 straight months that the inflation rate has been above the Bank of Japan's 2% target.

articles.title: Key study of Grail’s cancer detection test fails in setback for company - statnews.com
articles.description: Grail's blood test for detecting cancer early failed to meet its main goal in a giant study being conducted with England’s NHS, the company said.

articles.title: Inside Warner Bros. Discovery, Mood Among Many Staffers Shifts in Favor of Netflix Sale vs. Paramount Takeover - Variety
articles.description: Most Warner Bros. Discovery staffers are now supportive of Netflix's deal to acquire Warner Bros.'s studios and HBO Max rather than having WBD subsumed in its entirety by David Ellison's Paramount Skydance.

articles.title: Bitcoin price news: BTC steadies at $67,000 as traders pay for crash protection - CoinDesk
articles.description: The average bitcoin ETF investor now sits on a 20% paper loss, leaving the market vulnerable to capitulation selling if prices slide further, a Wintermute trader said.

articles.description: The US trade deficit deteriorated even though President Trump unleashed a barrage of tariffs to close trade imbalances.

articles.title: JPMorgan Says Trump’s $5 Billion Suit ‘Fraudulently’ Includes Dimon - Bloomberg
articles.description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. said President Donald Trump improperly named the bank’s chief executive officer, Jamie Dimon, as a defendant in his lawsuit over closure of his accounts in order to file the case in Florida state court.

articles.title: Amazon surpasses Walmart in annual revenue for first time, as both chase AI-fueled growth - CNBC
articles.description: The shuffle underscores the rivalry between the two retailers, particularly as Walmart expands its advertising and third-party marketplace businesses.

articles.description: Drug sponsors should nevertheless bolster their application with “confirmative evidence,” chief regulators Marty Makary and Vinay Prasad said on Wednesday, including mechanistic data or findings from related indications or animal models.
